description.para: Enum indicating what the current touch status is for the touchscreen.

briefdescription.para: The task is actively executing.
The task exists and is available to run, but is not currently running.
The task is delayed or blocked by a mutex, semaphore, or I/O operation.
The task is supended using task_suspend.
The task has been deleted using task_delete.

detaileddescription.para: The task handle does not point to a current or past task.

briefdescription.para: The task’s notification value will not be touched.
The task’s notification value will be bitwise ORed with the new value.
The task’s notification value will be incremented by one, effectively using it as a notification counter.
The task’s notification value will be unconditionally set to the new value.

detaileddescription.para: The task’s notification value will be set to the new value if the task does not already have a pending notification.

briefdescription.para: Small text font size.
Normal/Medium text font size.
Large text font size.
Medium centered text.
Large centered text.
Last interaction with screen was a quick press.
Last interaction with screen was a release.
User is holding screen down.

detaileddescription.para: An error occured while taking/returning the mutex

description.para: A callback function for a screen callback
This will be called each time its corresponding touch type happens.

briefdescription.para: (0,0) coordinate is the top left of the FOV
(0,0) coordinate is the center of the FOV
This enumeration defines different zero points for returned vision objects.
Color codes are just signatures with multiple IDs and a different type.
This enumeration defines different zero points for returned vision objects.
This enumeration defines different zero points for returned vision objects.
This structure contains the parameters used by the Vision Sensor to detect objects.

detaileddescription.para: This structure contains a descriptor of an object detected by the Vision Sensor.

inbodydescription.para: Object type, e.g. normal, color code, or line detection
Left boundary coordinate of the object
Top boundary coordinate of the object
Angle of a color code object in 0.1 degree units (e.g. 10 -> 1 degree, 155 -> 15.5 degrees)
Coordinates of the middle of the object (computed from the values above)
Coordinates of the middle of the object (computed from the values above)
Object type, e.g. normal, color code, or line detection
Left boundary coordinate of the object
Top boundary coordinate of the object
Angle of a color code object in 0.1 degree units (e.g. 10 -> 1 degree, 155 -> 15.5 degrees)
Coordinates of the middle of the object (computed from the values above)
Coordinates of the middle of the object (computed from the values above)

briefdescription.para: Represents the port type for an ADI port.
Represents the potentiometer version type.
The master controller.
The partner controller.
The horizontal axis of the controller’s left analog stick.
The vertical axis of the controller’s left analog stick.
The horizontal axis of the controller’s right analog stick.
The vertical axis of the controller’s right analog stick.
The first trigger on the left side of the controller.
The second trigger on the left side of the controller.
The first trigger on the right side of the controller.
The second trigger on the right side of the controller.
The up arrow on the left arrow pad of the controller.
The down arrow on the left arrow pad of the controller.
The left arrow on the left arrow pad of the controller.
The right arrow on the left arrow pad of the controller.
The ‘X’ button on the right button pad of the controller.
The ‘B’ button on the right button pad of the controller.
The ‘Y’ button on the right button pad of the controller.
The ‘A’ button on the right button pad of the controller.
Indicates the current 'brake mode' of a motor.
Indicates the units used by the motor encoders.
Indicates the current internal gear ratio of a motor.
This enumeration defines the different types of objects that can be detected by the Vision Sensor.
type definition for the pair of smart port and adi port for the basic adi devices
type definition for the triplet of smart port and two adi ports for the two wire adi devices
Points to a task handle.
Points to the function associated with a task.
A mutex..
Get the current status of the competition control.

simplesect.para: The competition control status as a mask of bits with COMPETITION_{ENABLED,AUTONOMOUS,CONNECTED}.
